snippet: The backing of Mrs. Palin, the former Alaska governor and 2008 vice-presidential nominee, provides Mr. Trump with a potential boost less than two weeks before the Iowa caucuses.
abstract: Sarah Palin, former Alaska governor and 2008 vice-presidential nominee, endorses Donald J Trump in Iowa, giving Trump both high-profile support and political boost 13 days before caucuses; it is uncertain whether Palin's support will make significant difference in long run, but it could alter course of events in key early state where she has amassed considerable influence among Tea Party loyalists.

byline.original: By ALAN RAPPEPORT and MAGGIE HABERMAN
byline.contributor: Alan Rappeport reported from Ames, and Maggie Haberman from New York. Matt Flegenheimer contributed reporting from Center Barnstead, N.H.

lead_paragraph: The backing of Mrs. Palin, the former Alaska governor and 2008 vice-presidential nominee, provides Mr. Trump with a potential boost less than two weeks before the Iowa caucuses.

headline.main: Sarah Palin Endorses Donald Trump, Which Could Bolster Him in Iowa
headline.print_headline: Palin Backs Trump With a Dash of Rogue Appeal
